docs.snippet: President Trump is lending credence to out-there Jonesisms, adding another “pinch-yourself-this-is-happening” element to our national journey into the upside-down.

headline.print_headline: In His Volleys, Trump Echoes a Provocateur
headline.main: In Trump’s Volleys, Echoes of Alex Jones’s Conspiracy Theories

docs.snippet: Anti-Trump outrage may be energizing the left, but it is also driving some centrist Trump voters rightward.
Online news outlets often write about refugees resettled in the U.S. with big, scary headlines. The facts tend to be a lot less dramatic.

headline.print_headline: Anxiety About Muslim Refugees Is Stoked Online by the Far-Right Media
headline.main: Anxiety About Muslim Refugees Is Stoked Online by the Far-Right Media

docs.snippet: After the revelations of huge data breaches, the new terms would cut the price for Yahoo’s core internet business by close to $300 million, a person with knowledge of the matter said.

headline.print_headline: Yahoo Is Said to Be Near Cheaper Deal With Verizon
headline.main: Yahoo and Verizon Are Said to Be Near a Cheaper Deal

docs.snippet: Defying political norms, President Trump has embraced the philosophy of disruption and management styles that have powered successful start-ups.

headline.print_headline: How Trump Became the First Silicon Valley President
headline.main: White House Echoes Tech: ‘Move Fast and Break Things’

docs.snippet: The police in Australia said the 42-year-old man had pretended to be the pop star as a way to lure explicit images from children online.
